intro: Lasiacis divaricata var. divaricata, commonly known as the silver dollar plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking, broad, silver-green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. This ornamental plant is often cultivated for its attractive foliage and is relatively easy to care for in suitable conditions.
